Post Content:
hashtag#hiring *Systems Engineer*, Denver, *United States*, fulltime hashtag#opentowork hashtag#Denverjobs hashtag#Coloradojobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#corptocorp hashtag#c2c hashtag#corp2corp hashtag#contractjobs hashtag#contractor hashtag#contractwork *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/dsecEXd4 Systems EngineerHybrid in DenverMust live in CO-no sponsorships or corp to corp ABOUT THE COMPANY  Our client is a leading non-profit organization in the financial services sector, specializing and servicing pension plans. Employees describe the company as "Family focused, offers work life balance, hybrid work model and great benefits." Located in the DTC area.  Exciting work that is challenging and always changing. Company that has a great mission and is committed to their members. A core value of a community that cares about each other while acting in the service of others.    Essential Duties/Responsibilities:    Implements, upgrades and repairs the Association's software and endpoints including personal computers, peripherals, virtual desktops and other end user technology. Responsible for maintaining standardization on endpoint devices. Implements and maintains security as it relates to end-user systems and applications. Jointly responsible for upgrades and outage notifications to all users. Develops procedures, standards, and guidelines. Serves as a technical resource and technical liaison for outside consultants and contractors as necessary. Trains users and peers on systems. Creates and maintains accurate documentation.  Assists Systems/Security Engineer and works with the Managed Security Service Provider as needed.   Responsible for maintaining user-level back-ups and restores including user data and personal computer images to ensure disaster recovery and business continuity. Ensures data is current, accessible and restorable. Jointly responsible for off-line removable back-up drive rotation. Works closely with Systems/Security Engineer and consultants to assure consistency.  Responsible for assisting the Systems/Security Engineer with ongoing testing and revision of the IT disaster recovery plan for the Association's information system infrastructure. Post Content:
hashtag#hiring *Systems Engineer*, Denver, *United States*, fulltime hashtag#opentowork hashtag#Denverjobs hashtag#Coloradojobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#corptocorp hashtag#c2c hashtag#corp2corp hashtag#contractjobs hashtag#contractor hashtag#contractwork *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/dsecEXd4 Systems EngineerHybrid in DenverMust live in CO-no sponsorships or corp to corp ABOUT THE COMPANY  Our client is a leading non-profit organization in the financial services sector, specializing and servicing pension plans. Employees describe the company as "Family focused, offers work life balance, hybrid work model and great benefits." Located in the DTC area.  Exciting work that is challenging and always changing. Company that has a great mission and is committed to their members. A core value of a community that cares about each other while acting in the service of others.    Essential Duties/Responsibilities:    Implements, upgrades and repairs the Association's software and endpoints including personal computers, peripherals, virtual desktops and other end user technology. Responsible for maintaining standardization on endpoint devices. Implements and maintains security as it relates to end-user systems and applications. Jointly responsible for upgrades and outage notifications to all users. Develops procedures, standards, and guidelines. Serves as a technical resource and technical liaison for outside consultants and contractors as necessary. Trains users and peers on systems. Creates and maintains accurate documentation.  Assists Systems/Security Engineer and works with the Managed Security Service Provider as needed.   Responsible for maintaining user-level back-ups and restores including user data and personal computer images to ensure disaster recovery and business continuity. Ensures data is current, accessible and restorable. Jointly responsible for off-line removable back-up drive rotation. Works closely with Systems/Security Engineer and consultants to assure consistency.  Responsible for assisting the Systems/Security Engineer with ongoing testing and revision of the IT disaster recovery plan for the Association's information system infrastructure. Ensures the organization can recover from a disaster in an allotted time frame. Jointly responsible for executing the plan during a declared disaster. Responsible for software and hardware inventory. Jointly responsible for software licensing.   Participates in cross-training for all systems.  Works with Systems/Security Engineer and consultants on various projects and trainings as assigned.  Responsible for working with Dev/Ops to minimize system down time. Responsible for software and hardware inventory. Jointly responsible for software licensing.   Participates in cross-training for all systems.  Works with Systems/Security Engineer and consultants on various projects and trainings as assigned.  Responsible for working with Dev/Ops to minimize system down time. hashtag#hiring *Systems Engineer*, Denver, *United States*, fulltime hashtag#opentowork hashtag#Denverjobs hashtag#Coloradojobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#corptocorp hashtag#c2c hashtag#corp2corp hashtag#contractjobs hashtag#contractor hashtag#contractwork *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/dsecEXd4 Systems EngineerHybrid in DenverMust live in CO-no sponsorships or corp to corp ABOUT THE COMPANY  Our client is a leading non-profit organization in the financial services sector, specializing and servicing pension plans. Employees describe the company as "Family focused, offers work life balance, hybrid work model and great benefits." Located in the DTC area.  Exciting work that is challenging and always changing. Company that has a great mission and is committed to their members. A core value of a community that cares about each other while acting in the service of others.    Essential Duties/Responsibilities:    Implements, upgrades and repairs the Association's software and endpoints including personal computers, peripherals, virtual desktops and other end user technology. Responsible for maintaining standardization on endpoint devices. Implements and maintains security as it relates to end-user systems and applications. Jointly responsible for upgrades and outage notifications to all users. Develops procedures, standards, and guidelines. Serves as a technical resource and technical liaison for outside consultants and contractors as necessary. Trains users and peers on systems. Creates and maintains accurate documentation. ğŸ¥ If Content Creation Isnâ€™t a Real Business, Then Neither Is Netflix.Every few months, someone says:â€œBeing a content creator isnâ€™t a real job.â€Yet those same people respect billion-dollar media companies like:âœ… Disney (Creates entertainment and monetizes it across platformsâ€”just like content creators.)âœ… Netflix (Built a business on subscriptionsâ€”just like Patreon & membership-based creators.)âœ… The Wall Street Journal (Sells paywalled contentâ€”just like Substack & premium newsletters.)Same business model. Different medium.The only real difference between a content creator and these companies? Scale.ğŸ¬ Creators Are the New Media CompaniesCreators arenâ€™t just â€œposting online.â€ Theyâ€™re building media companies in real-time.Hereâ€™s What People Donâ€™t Realize:ğŸ“¡ Creators own their distribution.- No network deals. No publishing gatekeepers.- Their audience is their platform.ğŸ’° Creators monetize like businesses.- Ads, sponsorships, memberships, consultingâ€”itâ€™s all revenue streams.- The same way traditional media profits from subscriptions & advertising.ğŸ‘‘ Creators are CEOs.- They run marketing, branding, production, partnerships, and salesâ€”all on their own.- They scale by hiring teams, automating workflows, and diversifying income.ğŸ“Š The Data Speaks for ItselfAnd the numbers prove it (shoutout to Tyler Chou is at SXSW for breaking these down!):ğŸ“ˆ The creator economy is projected to hit nearly $500B by 2027 (Goldman Sachs).â†’ Thatâ€™s on par with the entire film, music, and publishing industries.ğŸ‘¥ 12M people in the U.S. make a full-time living as creatorsâ€”more than all doctors, lawyers, engineers, and teachers combined.â†’ This isnâ€™t a nicheâ€”itâ€™s a workforce.ğŸ’° MrBeastâ€™s brand is valued at $5Bâ€”on par with companies like Spotify, Etsy, and Shake Shack.â†’ One creatorâ€™s business is worth as much as publicly traded corporations.ğŸ’µ Many full-time creators earn six figures a year, with top creators scaling into millions.â†’ This isnâ€™t a hobby. Itâ€™s a legitimate career path.ğŸŒŸ So Whatâ€™s the Real Difference?The biggest creators are building media empiresâ€”without the corporate middlemen.And thatâ€™s exactly why some people still donâ€™t take them seriously.Because the old system was built on gatekeepers.But the internet changed the game. Creators donâ€™t need permission. They donâ€™t need approval.And they definitely donâ€™t need someone else to tell them their work is â€œreal.â€Like it or not, creators arenâ€™t just building careers. Theyâ€™re building industries.-ğŸ’¬ Whatâ€™s one creator that made you realize content creation is a real business?-Day 21/90 of Tylerâ€™s hashtag#LinkedinWriting Challenge hashtag#CreatorEconomy hashtag#DigitalMarketing hashtag#MonetizingContent hashtag#OnePersonBusiness

Works closely with Systems/Security Engineer and consultants to assure consistency.  Responsible for assisting the Systems/Security Engineer with ongoing testing and revision of the IT disaster recovery plan for the Association's information system infrastructure. Ensures the organization can recover from a disaster in an allotted time frame. Jointly responsible for executing the plan during a declared disaster.  Recommends vendor products in hardware, software, and emerging technologies and may recommend solutions consistent with the Association's short- and long-term objectives.   Responsible for software and hardware inventory. Jointly responsible for software licensing.   Participates in cross-training for all systems.  Works with Systems/Security Engineer and consultants on various projects and trainings as assigned.  Responsible for working with Dev/Ops to minimize system down time. hashtag#hiring *Systems Engineer*, Denver, *United States*, fulltime hashtag#opentowork hashtag#Denverjobs hashtag#Coloradojobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#corptocorp hashtag#c2c hashtag#corp2corp hashtag#contractjobs hashtag#contractor hashtag#contractwork *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/dsecEXd4 Systems EngineerHybrid in DenverMust live in CO-no sponsorships or corp to corp ABOUT THE COMPANY  Our client is a leading non-profit organization in the financial services sector, specializing and servicing pension plans. Employees describe the company as "Family focused, offers work life balance, hybrid work model and great benefits." Located in the DTC area.  Exciting work that is challenging and always changing. Company that has a great mission and is committed to their members. A core value of a community that cares about each other while acting in the service of others.    Essential Duties/Responsibilities:    Implements, upgrades and repairs the Association's software and endpoints including personal computers, peripherals, virtual desktops and other end user technology. Responsible for maintaining standardization on endpoint devices. Implements and maintains security as it relates to end-user systems and applications. Jointly responsible for upgrades and outage notifications to all users. Develops procedures, standards, and guidelines. Serves as a technical resource and technical liaison for outside consultants and contractors as necessary. Trains users and peers on systems. Creates and maintains accurate documentation. Post Content:
hashtag#hiring *Systems Engineer*, Denver, *United States*, fulltime hashtag#opentowork hashtag#Denverjobs hashtag#Coloradojobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#corptocorp hashtag#c2c hashtag#corp2corp hashtag#contractjobs hashtag#contractor hashtag#contractwork *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/dsecEXd4 Systems EngineerHybrid in DenverMust live in CO-no sponsorships or corp to corp ABOUT THE COMPANY  Our client is a leading non-profit organization in the financial services sector, specializing and servicing pension plans. Employees describe the company as "Family focused, offers work life balance, hybrid work model and great benefits." Located in the DTC area.  Exciting work that is challenging and always changing. Company that has a great mission and is committed to their members. A core value of a community that cares about each other while acting in the service of others.    Essential Duties/Responsibilities:    Implements, upgrades and repairs the Association's software and endpoints including personal computers, peripherals, virtual desktops and other end user technology. Responsible for maintaining standardization on endpoint devices. Implements and maintains security as it relates to end-user systems and applications. Jointly responsible for upgrades and outage notifications to all users. Develops procedures, standards, and guidelines. Serves as a technical resource and technical liaison for outside consultants and contractors as necessary. Trains users and peers on systems. Creates and maintains accurate documentation.  Assists Systems/Security Engineer and works with the Managed Security Service Provider as needed.   Responsible for maintaining user-level back-ups and restores including user data and personal computer images to ensure disaster recovery and business continuity. Ensures data is current, accessible and restorable. Jointly responsible for off-line removable back-up drive rotation. Works closely with Systems/Security Engineer and consultants to assure consistency.  Responsible for assisting the Systems/Security Engineer with ongoing testing and revision of the IT disaster recovery plan for the Association's information system infrastructure. Ensures the organization can recover from a disaster in an allotted time frame. Jointly responsible for executing the plan during a declared disaster.
